H0.text: Light reactions are the first stage of photosynthesis.

H1.text: Consumption is the name of the first stage of photosynthesis.

H2.text: Absorption is the name of the first stage of photosynthesis.

H3.text: Contamination is the name of the first stage of photosynthesis.

A4.text: Light-dependent reactions are the chemical reactions involved in photosynthesis induced by light; all light-dependent reactions occur in thylakoids.

A5.text: The process always begins when light energy is absorbed by the reaction centers, proteins that contain photosynthetic pigments or chromophores.

A6.text: In plants, algae, and cyanobacteria, sugars are synthesized by a subsequent sequence of light-independent reactions called the Calvin cycle.
